In 2018, the Mayor of Hebron, a Palestinian city in the West Bank with a population of 220,000 offered Palestinians $5 for killing dogs. 

The mayor told Palestinians to kill as many dogs as possible and offered a $25 reward for killing 5 dogs. 

Thousands of dogs were then shot and killed by Palestinians in The West Bank. 

Images of dogs being tortured, killed and abused by Palestinians began spreading on social media at the time. 

Another Palestinian mayor, the Mayor of Tulkarm then followed suit and offered rewards for Palestinians to kill stray dogs. 

The mayor who announced the initiative Tayseer Abu Sneineh, had previously been convicted for his involvement in the 1980 Hebron terrorist attack which killed 6 Jewish people- 3 Israelis, 2 Americans & 1 Canadian.

#Hitler had 12 years to indoctrinate kids to Naziism in #Germany's schools. 

Yet, only 9 months into Hitler's rise to power, lifelong writer, editor & publisher Alexander Brin wrote (in Oct 1933) that #antisemitism was so deeply ingrained in classrooms that even if Hitler were "overthrown tomorrow," it would take generations to repair "the damage that has been done by the poison instilled into the minds of the children."

It did, in fact, take generations of denazification & Germans coming to terms with the true nature of the evil done during the Holocaust for their society to turn things around. 

Now I ask: what sort of dehamasification will be needed in #Gaza after its 17 years of rule over the education system that brainwashed young #Palestinians to their extremist & genocidal worldview?

This is an absolutely must-watch interview with Syrian-born Palestinian social activist Manar Al-Sharif.   

She went to Gaza to try to help the civilians there get necessities and education to better themselves and  had her eyes opened to the brutal and impoverished reality of Hamas in Gaza for the Palestinian people  

I watched almost all of it before I went to bed. I I’m now on the part  where Hamas threw her in prison for refusing to stop speaking up about Hamas’ mistreatment and theft of aid from the Gazan civilians they have left impoverished by stealing billions meant to better the lives of Palestinian families.  

Not  a short interview but worth listening to in a way a few interviews are.  Amazing stuff. Palestinian woman telling it like it is, and damn, it’s ugly.  

This shows why @IDF is doing a huge service to the poor Palestinian people brutalized and murdered and left with nothing by Hamas.  

An amazing part of this is where she mentions that the people told her life was better when the Israelis actually “occupied” Gaza. 

The people had work and pretty good lives and didn’t encounter the horrible brutality of Hamas. Those who remember these days really resent Hamas, she explains.  

Wow.

Sadly, in 2006 the Palestinians in Gaza voted Hamas into power, even though its charter explicitly calls for the genocide of Jews. This video and the terrorist attack on October 7th make the intentions of Hamas very clear. Hamas terrorists don't want a state alongside the State of Israel. They want a state instead of the State of Israel.
Hamas terrorists do not want "coexistence" with the Jews as they publicly and explicitly call for genocide and ethnic cleansing of Jews.

Watching the release of the hostages is the most surreal thing I’ve ever seen in my life.

None of this makes any sense. 

As I keep saying, if I look at these events with a human lens, I’ll lose my mind. It’s all so insane, on so many levels. 

It’s so hard to believe any of this is really happening.

This is a sensitive topic, and I don't underestimate the lives lost in this war. 

But, despite international media claims of Israel targeting journalists in Gaza, the facts are that Israel doesn't target journalists to silence them.

IDF didn't disproportionately kill non-terrorist journalists.

According to @mishtal research, 85 of the "journalists" killed in Gaza were active terrorists affiliated with Hamas or other terror organizations in Gaza. Another 5 "journalists" were killed while being close to other terrorists who were eliminated.

For example, the "journalist" Maztapa Taria who was killed alongside the "journalist" Hamza al-Dahdo, who according to documents found by the IDF in Gaza, both belonged to the terrorist organizations in Gaza. 

or the journalists Muhammad Mater, Anas Abu Shamla and Montaser al-Sawaf - all belong to the terrorist organization Hamas. All these are just examples of "journalists" killed in Gaza.

Only 19% of the killed journalists were not proven to be terrorists, and the circumstances of their deaths were not precisely determined. In any war, circumstances may become clear in the future, and sometimes journalists die in tragic circumstances

While in  Israel has press freedom and liberal democracy, allowing any journalist visiting Israel to speak freely, And every journalist who has been in Israel will testify to that. in Gaza, controlled by the fundamentalist Islamic terror organization Hamas, has no press freedom at all.

Every war is terrible, and the current conflict in Gaza is especially dire. As part of their military strategy, Hamas uses civilians as human shields, both in combat and as shields for their terror infrastructure and rocket launchers.

As a result, despite the IDF's immense efforts, civilians continuously suffer. Reports from Gaza on casualty numbers, IDF airstrikes, and fighting between IDF soldiers and Hamas are constantly quoted by international media, but verifying these claims is challenging, and many have been proven entirely false.

In Gaza, there are no journalists who can expose the truth about these numbers and reports. True journalists working in Gaza cannot reveal that, for example, in an airstrike, civilians were not killed, only Hamas militants were.

If a Gaza journalist dares to tell the truth about the number of terrorists killed, Hamas will kill them immediately them.
None of the real journalists in Gaza can tell the truth.

The truth is one of the casualties of war, so it's crucial to expose the journey of lies and manipulation by the terror organization Hamas.

Very few journalists in Gaza are genuine journalists, and even they can't tell the truth due to the dictatorial and terrorist rule in Gaza. The rest of the "journalists" in Gaza are not journalists but terrorists collaborating with Hamas.

It's time to understand that most journalists in Gaza are #TerroristsNotJournalists. And those who are real  journalists do not tell the truth.

A "press" vest, anyone can buy at "Ali Express", but not everyone who wears a press vest is a journalist.
#HamasislSIS #TerroristsNotJournalists

3 Jewish friends have been attacked by a gang of 20 men in central London for speaking Hebrew. 

The gang came up to them shouting ‘Are you Jewish?’ with one of the victims saying ‘Yes, I’m Jewish.’

Moments later the Jewish friends were punched in the head and neck while the attackers chanted ‘Free Palestine.’ 

One of the victims called the police 10 times in fear for their life with the operator dismissing their urgent calls for help saying ‘You are not the only one calling tonight.’ 

It took officers 28 minutes to arrive on the scene despite the incident occurring in the popular tourist area of Leicester Square, where police are always present. 

One of the victims needed hospital treatment after the attack. 

The attack took place around 1:30AM on Sunday morning and is now being treated as an antisemitic hate crime by the Metropolitan Police. 

Source: Daily Mail
